Table of Contents

Authoring the Model

For Eye Animator

  1. Create the right eye: Start by creating a smooth surface for the right eye, avoiding deformations. Ensure the UVs are properly set.
  2. Create the left eye: Mirror the right eye to create the left eye. FaceToons assumes that the left eye's UVs are identical but mirrored compared to the right eye.
  3. Vertex coloring: Paint the left eye's surface with a red vertex color channel value of 1. This tells FaceToons to unflip the iris and eye texture UVs for the left eye.

For Mouth Animator

Mouth Animator provides multiple ways to render mouth sprites. It comes with a built-in geometry, decal and multi-angle mouth support.

Using Geometry

Create mouth geometry which encompasses the entire area of the mouth and unwrap its UVs as desired. It is recommended to draw a mouth texture first and then clean-up the UVs based on the mouth texture. For models where mouths will be painted directly on the model this step is not necessary.

Using Projection (Decals)

No additional mouth material is required. Textures will be projected onto the model at runtime. Textures needed for this are outlined in the Making Textures part of the documentation.

Note on BlendShapes

Some characters might require additional blend-shape workflows to work. See Extending Frames.

Next Steps

See Making Textures.
